intro: Euphrasia × areschougii, commonly known as the hybrid eyebright, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland gardens or wet meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euphrasia × areschougii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional herbal medicine.
